programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth take time from their busy schedule to thank their fans by inviting them into their home to celebrate the holiday season. But when Dog decides he needs to help his son Garry believe in Santa Claus again the plan changes.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once a criminal himself, Dog knows how it feels to be hunted. In this episode of our series that focuses on the tumultuous home and professional life of bounty hunter Dwayne "Dog" Chapman.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa, who's just turned 18 and is studying to become a bondsman, gets to do some on-the-job training when she helps Dog hunt for Wayne, who's run out on a bond for second-degree assault.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Tim's got a big problem on his hands. One of his clients, Owen, has failed to appear in court. He's on bond for serious drug charges and now Tim could lose $30,000 if he doesn't catch Owen.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the Chapman clan start their hunt today.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog believes that the family that plays together stays together. But what happens when a family's idea of fun is getting high and running amuck? Today's case is a twofer, a brother and sister both charged with drug related offenses.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive is hard to pin down in Honolulu's downtown district--moving from hostel to hotel to apartment high-rise. But as the hunt evolves, Dog discovers that this alleged burglar isn't the only family member wanted by the law.

programme.desc: When a stripper goes on the lam, Dog has to bring her in--it's a tough job but somebody has to do it. Thankfully for the team, Lady Luck is presiding over the posse tonight.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog goes after Virginia, a hard-to-find lawbreaker. He gets a tip that a pickup truck will be going to Virginia's house. In true private-eye fashion.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team search for Jonah, a violent and desperate criminal facing 20 years in jail. The trail goes stale when Dog runs into evasive family members and an angry girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog decides to help two of his bondsmen buddies, Dave "Red" Widhelm and "Downtown" Bobby Brown. First up is Red, who has a client named Alvin who failed to appear on a $20,000 bond with charges of drug possession and distribution pending.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble--or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. On his search he'll encounter a felon with history of violence and an alleged affection for sawed-off shotguns.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog always wants to share the wisdom he has collected on the streets with the fugitives he captures. But today he's going to do double duty! His son-in-law Travis (and trainee bondsman) is also in need of some knowledge.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that it is better to give than to receive, so when a fellow bondsman grieving for his recently departed spouse requests his help, he jumps into action. Studying the fugitive's file the team uncovers a surprising fact.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado Dog tracks a fugitive who is on the run from the law for the first time. Reading the file Dog knows the young man's life is at the crossroads.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado, Dog`s on the hunt for a runner with more than a decade's worth of trouble with the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Two different young men; one has a taste for larceny, the other for strong sprits, both have a bad bad habit of missing their court dates.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When an alleged abuser goes on the lame Dog gathers the team to bring him in. As the leads grow colder Dog's determination only grows stronger. Finally a hot lead comes in and Dog sets the trap for his prey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive's sketchy associates and footloose ways spell trouble for Dog in today's hunt.

programme.title: The First 48 Presents: Homicide Squad Atlanta
programme.desc: A rookie detective struggles to unravel the mystery of a teenager found naked and shot to death in a city park; the case captures the hearts of the public; when the victim's car is discovered miles away, the mystery deepens.

programme.title: The First 48 Presents: Homicide Squad Atlanta
programme.desc: The Fallen Angel investigation takes homicide detectives back to the scene of the crime; as they sweep the city park for evidence, they discover a surveillance camera with vital footage of the victim's car at the time of her murder.

programme.title: The First 48 Presents: Homicide Squad Atlanta
programme.desc: After an intense interrogation, a suspect confesses to brutally murdering Misha Moore over $8; DNA results on the Fallen Angel rape kit match the soda bottle bought by the woman seen in surveillance video.

programme.title: The First 48 Presents: Homicide Squad Atlanta
programme.desc: New leads emerge in the Fallen Angel case; in the heart of Atlanta's wealthiest neighborhood, a man is brutally beaten and shot to death.

programme.title: The First 48 Presents: Homicide Squad Atlanta
programme.desc: On the one-year anniversary of Bridget Shiel's brutal murder, Lowe organizes a vigil and canvass to try and generate new leads and give her family some resolution; Detective Zimbrick gets a DNA match on a 16-year-old cold case.

programme.title: The First 48 Presents: Homicide Squad Atlanta
programme.desc: A DNA hit in the Bridget Shiel murder investigation identifies a compelling new suspect who was recently imprisoned for a double homicide; Benton investigates the death of a young man who was shot and killed while selling water on a hot summer day.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: Detectives investigate the murder of a man who received a call from a stranger moments before his death; a rookie detective investigates a triple homicide.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A powerful union activist disappears from a Detroit suburb; 45 years later, it remains one of the most notorious missing person cases of all time; the mystery of Jimmy Hoffa's disappearance features more twists and turns than a Hollywood movie.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: One of World War II's greatest unsolved mysteries: an incomparable work of art worth half a billion dollars, lost without a trace; perhaps the single most valuable object the Nazis ever stole, the quest for this treasure has lasted over 75 years.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On Christmas morning in 1945, five siblings vanish from their family home in West Virginia during a raging fire; despite the work of dozens of investigators and thousands of amateur sleuths, the mystery remains.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Magician and Houdini expert Bill Kalush secures access to Harry Houdini's diary previously kept from the public; experts begin to unveil the diary, using information gleaned from these personal accounts to form new insights into Houdini's life.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On July 20, 1973, martial arts superstar Bruce Lee dies under mysterious circumstances in Hong Kong, China.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Cultures all over the world have practiced complex techniques to preserve the human body after death; ancient Egyptians believed mummification ensured entrance into the next life; Buddhist monks practiced self-mummification.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Shocking new evidence reveals that advanced civilizations might have existed on Earth tens of thousands of years ago; is it possible that a technologically advanced society thrived on Earth, and did they leave behind a record.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In numerous ancient cultures throughout the world, stories were told of ancestors that came to Earth from the Pleiades star cluster, but could new scientific findings reveal that humankind's true origins lie not on Earth but 400 light years away.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In the Mojave Desert, there is a structure built to bestow everlasting life and according to the architect, the blueprint was provided by an extraterrestrial visitor known as the Integratron, could it actually provide the key to immortality.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Nestled within a remote valley in Utah is a ranch that some believe is a hotbed of strange, inexplicable phenomena including terrifying creatures, paranormal apparitions and lights in the sky.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: UFO witnesses have reported a wide variety of objects in Earth's skies and not only in modern times, but for centuries; could they offer important clues about other intelligent life.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Accounts of creatures that can shape shift from one form into another can be found, but could similarities between the ancient stories and modern-day alien abduction accounts reveal that shape shifters are real and have come to Earth.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: In the mid-to-late 1970s, Bundy, Gacy and BTK begin claiming victims, while Dahmer and the Green River Killer inch ever closer to realizing their grim fantasies; the dangerous men blend into their communities and elude close calls with police.

programme.title: Invisible Monsters: Serial Killers in America
programme.desc: With their confidences growing in 1978, Bundy, Gacy, Dahmer, the Green River Killer and BTK continue their game of cat and mouse with law enforcement; Gacy and Bundy are finally brought to justice; Dahmer struggles to resist his murderous urges.

programme.desc: Mildred Muhammad--ex-wife of infamous "DC Sniper" John Allen Muhammad--reveals how the man she loves disintegrated into a monster who threatens to kill her.

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: Melissa Moore--daughter of Keith Hunter Jesperson, infamously known as the "Happy Face Killer" tells her own personal story as the daughter of a serial killer.

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: Karen Kuzma--sister of John Wayne Gacy--comes out of the shadows to reveal intimate details of one of the world's most notorious serial killers.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: In 1989, 21-year-old Lyle and 18-year-old Erik Menendez walked into their parents' den and killed them. In this limited series premiere, Erik Menendez himself shares in stunning detail the events of the week leading up to the murders and the motive behind the crime that shocked America.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: The Trial of the Century takes a shocking turn when the defense says Erik and Lyle Menendez killed their parents after years of sexual abuse.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: Erik Menendez recalls his mother's decline in the years leading up to the murders and looks on in agony as his brother Lyle testifies, vividly describing the abuse at the hands of their father.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 70s and early 80s, a terrorist group known as the FALN is suspected of setting off bombs in major U.S. cities. Their goal - to bring attention to the Puerto Rican independence movement. As the bombings escalate, innocent lives are lost. FBI agents and police are is in a deadly race to stop this murderous group with a dangerous cause.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, a ruthless grab for power leads to a full-scale mob war. The local Mafia crime family splits in two as the young and the old fight to the death. The FBI is caught in the middle as they infiltrate the syndicate through informants and high-tech surveillance. Agents must find a way to bring down the organization before their civil war leads to innocent causalities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Lincoln County, Nebraska, a fugitive drug dealer engaged in a shootout with state troopers, wounding two of them, and eluded capture after a high-speed chase. Authorities immediately set up a statewide manhunt, connecting the fugitive to a murder in western Nebraska. A chance sighting led FBI agents to a second confrontation with the killer, who was more determined than ever to escape the law.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June 1973, a young girl was abducted from a state park on the Missouri River while camping with her family. Several months passed with no leads, then an FBI agent took a particular interest in the case. Using a new technique known as criminal profiling, he predicted that the kidnapper would contact the girl's family on the one-year anniversary of her abduction. When this prediction came true, the FBI agent noted behavioral clues, hoping that they could lead him to the kidnapper.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980's, a pair of serial bank robbers gained a reputation among law enforcement officials as formidable bandits. Using the same modus operandi, the two men took hostages and emptied bank vaults across the Midwest. After the criminals escaped from police custody, FBI agents familiar with the bandits believed that they would attempt a grand-scale heist. By conducting surveillance on known associates of the criminals, authorities tried to anticipate the next target.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1984, the son of a successful real estate developer was kidnapped in front of his father's business in Miami. After the father received a $3 million ransom demand from a self-proclaimed terrorist, the FBI became involved. Based on witness descriptions of the car used in the kidnapping, authorities began to suspect a pair of Colombian nationals with a known grudge against the developer's family.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A New Jersey State Trooper is shot to death on the side of Interstate 80 near the Pennsylvania border. Witnesses to the shooting identify the shooter's car. Police issue an APB, and locate the vehicle hours later. Fingerprinting of the vehicle points to a fugitive wanted on bank robbery charges. Authorities who inspect the fugitive's home find some incriminating evidence including a box of bullets linked to the Trooper's murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A man is found suffocated in his Pennsylvania home, his checkbook, credit cards and vehicle appear to have been stolen. Fingerprints from the victim identify a recent escapee from a minimum-security prison, as well as his girlfriend. Investigators flag the dead man's credit cards, and are alerted when one is used in North Dakota. The FBI is called in and joins another task force already assembled because of a suspected kidnapping.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A day that began with a class field trip ended with a parent's worst nightmare. An 11-year-old girl was missing. Her parents were certain she was no runaway. When they failed to find her in their quiet Illinois neighborhood, they called the police. The FBI soon joined the investigation and family and friends worked with detectives and agents in an urgent search for the missing girl. Faced with conflicting witness reports and false leads, agents wouldn't stop until they found the girl, and the truth.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1992, a man returned to his Memphis home and discovered that his wife was missing. The husband, as well as his friends, family and neighbors began to receive ransom calls. FBI agents noticed that one neighbor seemed to have the best rapport with the kidnapper. They began to question his level of involvement, but had to proceed carefully, knowing that he could be their only link to the missing woman.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A California bank manager panics and calls in the FBI after the door to his vault refuses to open. Upon inspection, the vault has been blasted into from the ceiling, and over $2 million in valuables is gone. When agents find no clues as to the robbers or their whereabouts in California, they send details of the crime to other FBI field offices. It is not long before agents in Ohio are investigating a bank vault robbery that is strikingly similar to the California heist.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, violent militants are intent on turning the US Commonwealth into a communist dictatorship. They murder a policeman, turns their guns on a busload of unarmed Navy workers, and even launch an attack on the FBI. These ruthless killers have vowed to fight to the death. The FBI must use every tactic at their disposal to track down the terrorists and bring them to justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 1980s, the FBI matches wits with a cunning bank robber -- a lone gunman responsible for the longest string of unsolved bank robberies in FBI history. The robber's planning is meticulous. He executes his crimes with military precision. It will take the combined skills of local police and dozens of agents to catch a criminal mastermind they call, "The Shootist."

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Lincoln County, Nebraska, a fugitive drug dealer engaged in a shootout with state troopers, wounding two of them, and eluded capture after a high-speed chase. Authorities immediately set up a statewide manhunt, connecting the fugitive to a murder in western Nebraska. A chance sighting led FBI agents to a second confrontation with the killer, who was more determined than ever to escape the law.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: An Arkansas State Trooper is shot and killed after pulling over a van for a traffic violation. Officers apprehend the shooter, after a car chase and shootout. ATF is alerted when officers find weapons and explosives in the man's vehicle. Further testing of the weapons reveals one was used in a murder several months earlier. ATF traces some of the firearms to purchases made by another man from and arms dealer. They also match silencer marks from the weapons to a third man previously arrested for stealing a flatbed truck.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1992, a man returned to his Memphis home and discovered that his wife was missing. The husband, as well as his friends, family and neighbors began to receive ransom calls. FBI agents noticed that one neighbor seemed to have the best rapport with the kidnapper. They began to question his level of involvement, but had to proceed carefully, knowing that he could be their only link to the missing woman.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At 9:30 am on the morning of January 30, 1997, Richmond, VA police respond to a report of shots fired at a local bank. Two masked men brandishing automatic weapons confront, and open fire on officers responding to the call. The gunmen exit the bank, and retreat on foot, eventually eluding the officers. The FBI soon responds, only to find one bank teller dead, another wounded, and the bank's security guard shot four times, yet still alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 1970s, the FBI had a working knowledge of anti-Castro terrorists operating in the United States. But then a new group appeared, more violent and aggressive than their predecessors. All agents had to go on was a series of chilling phone calls, a mysterious voice, and the threat of more violence. FBI field offices from New York to Miami coordinated their efforts, determined to catch the vicious killers.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, extortionists plant a thousand pound bomb in a Nevada casino and demand millions of dollars, or they will detonate the device. The bomb is the largest explosive device the FBI has ever seen. Detonation would be a disaster. Agents and bomb experts must disarm the deadly device, and stop the dangerous extortionist who built it.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Henderson, NV, a suburb of Las Vegas, two robbers brandishing assault rifles ambush armored guards as they exit their truck on March 3, 2000. The robbers kill both guards and seize $5,000. As the killers run to their getaway car, a police officer arrives and opens fire, striking one escaping assailant in the leg. After loosing the killers in a chase, police collect blood left by the injured robber and bullet casings from the firefight.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Washington DC professor is shot and killed as she tries to get into her car. The killer leaves the body in the parking lot and drives away in her vehicle. A week later, a man robs a bank, and security cameras capture the same vehicle as the getaway car. The FBI believes they are dealing with the same man. Days later, the same vehicle is involved in a shootout with police, but eventually would elude them. Eventually, the vehicle is found, the interior covered with red dye from the stolen bank packs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In September 1997, a team of masked gunmen robbed an armored car facility in Los Angeles, and made off with $18.9 million, the largest takeover heist in U.S. history. An employee believed she recognized the voice of one of the robbers, and FBI agents began conducting surveillance on a former employee of the facility. With only one piece of physical evidence, a fragment of a vehicle taillight, authorities hoped to connect him to the crime, and locate his accomplices.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 70s and early 80s, a terrorist group known as the FALN is suspected of setting off bombs in major U.S. cities. Their goal - to bring attention to the Puerto Rican independence movement. As the bombings escalate, innocent lives are lost. FBI agents and police are is in a deadly race to stop this murderous group with a dangerous cause.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On October 2, 1987, a Boston police officer responding to a domestic disturbance call was fatally wounded. Local authorities launched a citywide manhunt, but were only able to find the fingerprints of the chief suspect. Believing that he had fled the area, the FBI followed the suspect's trail to the west coast and then across the Mexican border, always aware of the desperation of a cop killer and of the need for justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On the day before Thanksgiving, a mother discovered her 10 year-old son was missing from his school. No one knew how it could have happened. Within hours, the boy's entire family was frantically searching for him. The few leads in the case quickly turned cold and the FBI was called in to aid in the investigation. The search by agents and local authorities would cover a thousand miles to expose the kidnapper and find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Henderson, NV, a suburb of Las Vegas, two robbers brandishing assault rifles ambush armored guards as they exit their truck on March 3, 2000. The robbers kill both guards and seize $5,000. As the killers run to their getaway car, a police officer arrives and opens fire, striking one escaping assailant in the leg. After loosing the killers in a chase, police collect blood left by the injured robber and bullet casings from the firefight.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the Spring of 1997, a killer preying on senior citizens terrorizes the River Parish area of Southern Louisiana. By May, local police and the New Orleans FBI are exploring a connection between the April 9 murder of a 71-year old widow and the May 9 murder of a retired couple. A month later, authorities forward information on the crimes to the FBI's Behavioral Science Unit in Quantico, VA, hoping a profile will help them narrow the field of possible suspects.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1996, two men entered a pawnshop in Birmingham, Alabama, and ruthlessly murdered the employees. Unbeknownst to the killers, a secret video surveillance camera recorded the shooting. Local police and the FBI released images of the crime to the media, and were quickly able to identify the perpetrators. Now authorities had to find two cold-blooded killers who knew that they were being pursued for murder one.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In New York, the FBI and local police join forces to battle the constant influx of Colombian cocaine into the city's ports. One detective goes undercover, posing as a Mafia wise-guy, and infiltrates a drug gang connected to Pablo Escobar's Medellin cartel. The detective must be bold, but cautious, taking on the role of a tough-guy, but always aware that if the gang suspects anything, they won't hesitate to kill him.

programme.title: On Death Row
programme.desc: Werner Herzog heads to a Texas maximum security prison to speak with death row inmates and understand what their daily lives are like.

programme.title: Dateline NBC

programme.title: Dateline NBC

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A man convicted of murdering a woman in her upscale Austin, Texas, home tells his story for the first time.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A double homicide in upstate New York leads detectives on a cross-country investigation to piece together a case with a surprising suspect at the center.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: When a Pennsylvania man who was convinced his messy divorce put a target on his back is found stabbed to death, his friends and family realize he was right all along in predicting his own gruesome murder.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: As detectives investigate a mother of two's sudden disappearance, her friends and family reveal she feared she was being stalked.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A family vacation turns into a nightmare when the wife is found face-down in the lake.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, Tiffany Rowell and three of her friends were brutally murdered in their affluent Clear Lake, Texas.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Rachael Mullenix, 19, was convicted of stabbing her mother, Barbara Mullenix, on Sept. 13, 2006, and then packing her bloodied corpse in a cardboard box before dumping it in Newport Bay on the California coast.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police get a clue about a couple who disappeared on Memorial Day weekend during an in-progress robbery. The evidence found solves a brutal crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim had ingested a massive amount of cyanide. An unlikely clue _ a flaw on a mailing envelope _ exposed a murderer who was willing to kill innocent people.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Michigan State University grad student disappeared and was presumed dead. With the help of a professor of geological sciences, police hoped to get the 'dirt' on her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, the Florida mobile home of Effie and Michael Ratley catches fire and Michael heroically rescues his wife and infant son. A month later, his wife is found beaten to death in a bedroom of his parents' home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Security cameras in a casino tracked a young woman's movements until shortly before she disappeared. She was never seen again, but through the evidence she left behind, she was able to tell investigators what happened to her and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tracey Frame, 35, was convicted of killing David Nixon in April 2002 after he planned to end their relationship.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On Halloween night 2004, Adriane Insogna and Leslie Mazzara were brutally murdered in their Napa, California home.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On May 12, 1994, Crystal Perry was viciously murdered in her home in Bridgton, Maine. Michael Hutchinson, 32, was found guilty of murder in the 1994 slaying at Perry's home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, when teenager Tara Munsey goes missing after a work shift at a Virginia restaurant, it is unknown if she ran away or if she was the victim of foul play.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman was brutally murdered in her home, and the only witnesses to the crime were the family dogs. An expert in canine behavior was convinced the killer knew both the victim and the animals, and he was determined find out what the dogs had seen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After shooting his victims in the head, the killer staged the scene, placed the incriminating evidence into a plastic bag and tossed it into the river.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, Virginia Beach police arrive at the Makdessi apartment to find Elise Makdessi and her lover Quincy Brown dead.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, Brian & Beverly Mauck were found dead in their Graham, Washington home. Using a bloody palm print and shoe prints at the scene, investigators focus their attention on Daniel Tavares, who had previously been inking a tattoo on Brian's back.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, Susan Fassett was gunned down as she left church choir practice in Poughkeepsie, NY. Her husband Jeff became the prime suspect, until he was cleared by police, who then suspected to Fred Andros, with whom Susan had her affair.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the early hours of a morning just before Christmas, a college co-ed was abducted from the parking lot of her apartment. Her body was found later that day; she'd been sexually assaulted and then shot at point blank range.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: One warm summer afternoon, the town of Verona, Wisconsin faced its first triple homicide. To solve the case, investigators had to delve into the world of high rollers and offshore betting.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors don't know why the young scientist is gravely ill. When tests finally reveal the cause, it's too late to save him. Police hope that lab analysis of his hair, showing when attempts were made on his life and what was used will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After the suspect was convicted of arson and murder, he maintained his innocence but was sentenced to 25 years in prison. He turned to the law books in the prison library and TV about forensic science and set out to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman was found dead on the bedroom floor of her apartment. The crime scene yielded little of value, and investigators wondered if they would find enough evidence to make a case, much less catch a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a hit-and-run boating accident caused the death of a popular young man, investigators faced the daunting task of searching for one boat among 1200 others.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of a respected police officer was murdered in her own home. The crime went unsolved for more than a decade, and then a newly formed Cold Case Unit took a fresh look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was one of the most unusual cases in forensic history. Investigators had to find a way to solve a murder case with evidence which consisted of a squashed tomato found at the crime scene, and tiny, pinpoint reflections of light in a photograph.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1995, Palm Beach waitress Denise O'Neill is abducted and murdered. Her neighbor Luis Caballero arouses suspicions by his odd behavior toward TV crews covering the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2008, Illinois emergency response came upon a garage fire and a man was found crushed beneath a truck.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, when Derrick Duehren returned to his Oregon home, it had burned to the ground and his wife Roxanne's charred remains were found in the rubble. Investigators set out to determine if it was an unfortunate accident or arson and murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman in the back of the truck was flailing her arms, screaming. They thought she was doing something dangerous for the fun of it. But when they found a jacket near a pool of blood, they knew what they'd seen wasn't a joy ride.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The decade-old murder of a young Texas housewife is investigated.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2006, Texas real estate agent Sarah Anne Walker was found brutally murdered in a model home. Weeks later, a witness came forward who may have seen the killer. Police used forensic hypnosis to help him recall every detail of the man's appearance.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Even though their daughter had run away before, she'd always come back. Her parents were sure this time would be no different, but they were wrong.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an off-duty policeman was shot dead, his fellow officers were determined to solve the crime. They needed clues to find the killer, and they discovered them in tiny fibers and an asthma inhaler.

programme.desc: A woman was brutally murdered in her home, and the only witnesses to the crime were the family dogs. An expert in canine behavior was convinced the killer knew both the victim and the animals, and he was determined find out what the dogs had seen.

programme.desc: Seattle police had no suspects in the violent murder of post-grunge singer, Mia Zapata. More than a decade passed before the evidence collected by a prescient medical examiner could be used by forensic scientists to identify the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.desc: A woman was brutally murdered in her home, and the only witnesses to the crime were the family dogs. An expert in canine behavior was convinced the killer knew both the victim and the animals, and he was determined find out what the dogs had seen.

programme.desc: A security guard disappeared from his post without a trace; his remains were found a year later in a remote camp site.¾

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: A passionate beekeeper in Omaha, and a Pittsburgh based seasoned mosaic artist.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: In Kansas City, you can’t say tattoos without saying the name Wes Grimm. For three tattoo artists, he’s not just a name — he’s also a judge. Can these artists design a tattoo worthy of the name, and who will have just enough heart to win?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Stay the course in the Driftless Region of Wisconsin when you explore the Troll Capital of the World. Join a mug club, satisfy your sweet tooth, and journey back in time as you fall asleep in a restored inn.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero takes to the streets to quiz people on the wildest, wackiest news stories. In "Imagination Station," contestants answer questions for cash about witty co-workers, life-saving screenings and teaching telemarketers a lesson.

programme.title: Salute to Heroes
programme.desc: (2023) WXII and the Triad CW recognize the 2023 American Red Cross "Salute to Heroes" recipients of the Triad.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: From longboards to wool sweaters, these amazing creators make beautiful, functional pieces of art.

programme.title: Back on Track: Racing Returns to North Wilkesboro
programme.desc: The foundation of modern-day racing was built at North Wilkesboro Speedway. After years away, NASCAR returns to North Wilkesboro Speedway with the upcoming All Star Race.

programme.title: Escaping The Blade
programme.desc: Why California's sex traffickers are walking free while victims wait in fear and how organizations are fighting to protect survivors.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Ride a legendary wooden roller coaster. Discover a local brewery that taps the spring-fed water of an Iowa Great Lake. Book a stay at a resort that has it all from water slides to zip lines.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Celebrate some of the Midwest's holiday favorites. Where scotcheroos take center stage, snicker salads delight, and the pink stuff surprises the pallet.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Scott's life revolves around everyone's favorite four-legged friends, from rescuing and caring for countless dogs, his spirit is unwavering. Today Meaghan gives back a day full of moments for him and his beloved canine companion.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find The World Championship Dainty Contest, women tackling stereotypes, and a free after-school arts program? The same place that's home to a half-century hat collection and a downtown lounge celebrating the Derby's unsung heroes.

programme.title: Madness at the Madhouse: A WXII 12 Racing Returns Special
programme.desc: Explore the history, splendor, and excitement of racing at Bowman Gray Stadium in Winston-Salmem, NC.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: In this episode, we go across the country to show stories of unlikely heroes. The type of hero we all have met at least once in our life: teachers. Their life-altering acts and the impact on their students will warm your heart.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Venture into Taos, New Mexico! Engage with the sacred traditions and life lessons of the people of Taos Pueblo, experience life off-the-gridn and enjoy thrilling river rafting adventures on the Rio Grande.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: In Arkansas, Jimmy Luv screams his way through a zipline, the guys meet a woman caring for dozens of stray cats, then visit an animal sanctuary with rescued big cats—and a surprise bear. It’s chaos, it’s kindness, it’s feline-fueled fun.

programme.title: Juvenile Lifers: Road to Redemption
programme.desc: (2019) Juvenile Lifers: Road to Redemption focuses on people who were sentenced to life in prison as juveniles. WGAL News 8's Matt Barcaro examines how these these former offenders are re-entering society and the reaction from victims' families.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: One evening in 1999, Cythnia Jaramillo shows up at a home wearing nothing but a dog collar. She had been tortured and sexually assaulted for days. Her escape leads investigators to discover a gruesome string of kidnappings and murders.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Young, single, and new to Sacramento, Aurora knows what she wants and goes after it. Three Sacramento bachelors will try to win her over with a day of tango lessons, wood working and a jam session.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Odd grasshoppers, unusual animal mating and buggy beer… Host Frank Nicotero has these questions and more for some Cincinnati locals – with cash on the line.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a car crashing into a home to a lemur fleeing a DUI scene, these captivating real-life stories explore intense arrests caught on film.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Manny Hernandez of Barrels and Boards in Raynham pushes the pace against Chef Ryan Dziki of Wild Fox Pierogi. Will the chefs be able to identify the right ingredients and replicate each other’s sauces before the clock runs out?

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Whether it's a wrestling star training through grief, champion rollerskaters challenged on the world stage, or a cycling team pushing through obstacles, Iowans don't back down when the going gets tough.

programme.title: The Long Road Home
programme.desc: In the aftermath of Hurricane Helene, the communities of Western North Carolina were forever changed. "The Long Road Home" is a WXII 12 original documentary that captures powerful stories of loss, hope, and recovery.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Birmingham’s favorite bartenders take Kate on a world tour of cocktails with tropical tiki showstoppers, aromatic Middle Eastern flavors, blue-collar dive bar favorites, and Kate’s first and truest love – agave spirits.

programme.title: WXII Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from WXII.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Michael Ferrazzani, creator of Ya Mamma’s sauce, challenges the North End born Italian stallion, Chef Kenny Palazzolo, to a true neighborhood duel. Can Michael’s Grandma inspired dish bring down the chef who lives, laughs and cooks Italian?

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero faces off with a professional wrestler on the streets of New Orleans! Plus, he asks locals questions about a man with more than 2,000 Crocs and an unorthodox cologne.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Three brutal cold cases remain unsolved for decades until advances in forensic technology bring investigators closer than ever to finding answers for the victims’ families and friends.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin and Ryan surprise a little boy awaiting a heart transplant with a fun-filled afternoon at Boston Chidlren's Hospital. From video games and candy, to a hot sauce challenge, the team will put a smile on everyone's face.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: You can’t have Sacramento without the Kings, and you can’t have the Kings without some seriously delicious grub. Chef Sara Arbabian is up against Chef Greg Desmangles to serve up an upscale take on their favorite courtside dishes.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Answer: This European candy is made on a bowling alley lane. Question: What is, you’ll have to watch this episode to find out? In southern California, we explore a thriving Danish community where Christmas shopping is always in season.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: When homesick college student Miya Marcano books a flight to south Florida for the weekend, her family is thrilled. But when the plane lands, Miya is nowhere to be found.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Join us as we skip the line of Greenville's most sought after weekend eateries for brunch. We'll head to Southern Culture and enjoy music with our grits, check out the Bohemian's DIY Bloody Mary Bar, and round out the day with Biscuit Head and Hen Dough.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: It’s a culinary battle of the senses between two iconic chefs in the City Beautiful. Watch as Chef Liz of Garp & Fuss in Winter Park takes on Chef Trina of Se7en Bites in The Milk District. It’s The Knife versus The Whisk!

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Dive into the Midwest's fried delights. From Friday night fish fries to tasty testicles and fried grilled cheese? Enjoy the area's most iconic and delectable crispy fried goodness.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find a Neurodiverse Universe, a sidewalk juggling optimist, and free fresh veggies? The same place where pollinators are prioritized and where records get their grooves.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Local radio personality, Greg Adams, wants to shine a light on all parts of his beloved city and prove that Milwaukee has a lot more to offer than people might expect. In each episode, Greg is joined by a notable personality from the community who shows him their favorite spots and the best ways to experience them.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda Machon meets with a different guest each episode who will show off their favorite spots in Albuquerque and the best way to experience this one-of-a-kind city. This series is all about discovering everything that makes ABQ unique and exciting.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Chris has an unstoppable spirit, despite the challenges of Down syndrome. His resilience has propelled him to extraordinary achievements, including clinching the gold in Greece. Meaghan takes him on a whirlwind of experiences tailored just for him.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: WXII Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from WXII.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Maker Nation

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Every city has its own local flavor, culture and vibe. Only In celebrates communities across America and the people, activities and history that make each place unique. From must-try activities to hidden gems and hotspots, to dedicated changemakers, these stories are sure to inspire a deeper love and appreciation for your hometown and beyond.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Ted wants to live to 100 with his beloved wife beside him. But his oral health threatens his future. Kristy’s a FIXT staffer desperate to smile big on her wedding day. Will love help them face their fears?

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: It's cuteness overload at a rescue farm for disabled animals and Justin's donation makes a huge difference. The guys roll out trivia bowling for Winston-Salem locals, sparking tons of laughs. Jimmy Luv kindly hides cash for lucky strangers to find.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find a vintage scooter delivering burritos and a seafood market with the freshest catch in town? The same place with repurposed vending machines dispensing unique art and wedding dresses made into hand-crafted heirlooms.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: In “Free Spirit,” award-winning bartender and host Kate Gerwin takes to the road and meets people in their workplaces and their favorite watering holes.

programme.title: The Freedom Center
programme.desc: Across centuries of struggle, freedom has carried many meanings, some painful, some powerful. This documentary pulls back the curtain on forgotten stories and surprising truths, leaving one question: what does freedom really look like today, and what might it become tomorrow?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: WXII 12 Presents: The Year of The Trail
programme.desc: (2023) From the coastal shores to the mountain peaks, WXII 12's Lanie Pope explores the magnificent trails that North Carolina has to offer.
